tableDataSource_schema.json.title: Table DataSource
tableDataSource_schema.json.description: Table data source is a table, feature class, or raster that resides in a registered workspace (either a folder or geodatabase). In the case of a geodatabase, if versioned, use version to switch to an alternate geodatabase version. If version is empty or missing, the registered geodatabase version will be used.

dataSourceName.description: The fully-qualified string value used to specify where the dataSource is derived.

gdbVersion.description: If applicable, the value indicating the version of the geodatabase.

type.description: String value indicating the type for the dataSource. The value for a Table DataSource is `table`.

workspaceId.description: The unique string value used to identify the datasource's workspace.

dynamicMapLayer_source_schema.json.title: Dynamic map layer
dynamicMapLayer_source_schema.json.description: A dynamic map layer refers to a layer in the current map service. More information on this can be found in the [ArcGIS REST API help](http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/rest/apiref/layersource.html).

gdbVersion.description: If applicable, specify this to use an alternate geodatabase version.

type.description: A string value indicating the type.

type_schema.json.title: type
type_schema.json.description: Contains information about an attribute field.

domains.description: A comma-delimited series of domain objects for each domain in the type.

id.description: A unique string or numerical ID for the type.

name.description: A user-friendly name for the type.

templates.description: Defined as a property of the layer definition when there are no types defined; otherwise, templates are defined as properties of the types.

template_schema.json.title: template
template_schema.json.description: Templates describe features that can be created in a layer. They are generally used with feature collections and editable web-based CSV layers. Templates are not used with ArcGIS feature services as these already have templates defined in the service. They are also defined as properties of the layer definition when there are no defined types. Otherwise, templates are defined as properties of the types.

description.description: A string value containing a detailed description of the template.

drawingTool.description: An optional string that can define a client-side drawing tool to be used with this feature.

name.description: A string containing a user-friendly name for the template.

prototype.description: A feature object representing a prototypical feature for the template.

esriDocumentation.additionalInformation: drawingTool strings: esriFeatureEditToolPolygon, esriFeatureEditToolTriangle, esriFeatureEditToolRectangle, esriFeatureEditToolLeftArrow, esriFeatureEditToolRightArrow, esriFeatureEditToolEllipse, esriFeatureEditToolUpArrow, esriFeatureEditToolDownArrow, esriFeatureEditToolCircle, esriFeatureEditToolFreehand, esriFeatureEditToolLine, esriFeatureEditToolText, esriFeatureEditToolPoint

feature_schema.json.title: feature
feature_schema.json.description: Contains information about an attribute field and feature geometry.

attributes.description: The feature attributes. A JSON object that contains a dictionary of name-value pairs. The names are the feature field names. The values are the field values, and they can be any of the standard JSON types: string, number, and boolean. Note that date values are encoded as numbers. The number represents the number of milliseconds since epoch (January 1, 1970) in UTC.

geometry.description: It can be any of the supported geometry types.

symbol.description: Symbol used for drawing the feature.

geometry_schema.json.title: geometry
geometry_schema.json.description: Please refer to the links below for objects which define the JSON formats of geometry and spatial reference objects.

multipoint_geometry_schema.json.title: multipointGeometry
multipoint_geometry_schema.json.description: Contains an array of points, along with a spatial reference field.

hasM.description: Indicates whether the geometry contains M coordinate values.

hasZ.description: Indicates whether the geometry contains Z coordinate values.

points.description: An array that corresponds to 2D and 3D points.

spatialReference.description: The spatial reference can be defined using a well-known ID (WKID) or well-known text (WKT).

point_geometry_schema.json.title: pointGeometry
point_geometry_schema.json.description: Defines the JSON formats of the point and spatial reference objects.

m.description: M coordinate which contains measures used for linear referencing.

spatialReference.description: The spatial reference can be defined using a well-known ID (WKID) or well-known text (WKT).

x.description: X coordinate which is measured along the east/west axis.

y.description: Y coordinate which is measured along the north/south axis.

z.description: Z coordinate which measures height or elevation.

polygon_geometry_schema.json.title: polygonGeometry
polygon_geometry_schema.json.description: A polygon contains an array of rings and a spatial reference.

hasM.description: Indicates whether the geometry contains M coordinate values.

hasZ.description: Indicates whether the geometry contains Z coordinate values.

rings.description: Represents an array of rings. Each ring is an array of points.

spatialReference.description: The spatial reference can be defined using a well-known ID (WKID) or well-known text (WKT).

polyline_geometry_schema.json.title: polylineGeometry
polyline_geometry_schema.json.description: Contains an array of paths and a spatialReference.

hasM.description: Indicates whether the geometry contains M coordinate values.

hasZ.description: Indicates whether the geometry contains Z coordinate values.

paths.description: Three nested array levels describing a polyline. The first level describes individual paths; the second describes the points of these paths; and the third gives the coordinates of the points.

spatialReference.description: The spatial reference can be defined using a well-known ID (WKID) or well-known text (WKT).

mosaicRule_schema.json.title: mosaicRule
mosaicRule_schema.json.description: The image service uses a mosaic rule to mosaick multiple rasters on the fly. The mosaic rule parameter is used by many image service operations, for example, export image and identify operations.

ascending.description: Indicate whether to use ascending or descending order.

fids.description: A list that defines a subset of rasters used in the mosaic, be aware that the rasters may not be visible at all scales.

itemRenderingRule.description: The rendering rule applies on items before mosaicking.

lockRasterIds.description: Lock a few rasters in the image service. Used together with `esriMosaicLockRaster`.

mosaicMethod.description: A string value that determines how the selected rasters are ordered.

mosaicOperation.description: Use the mosaic operation to resolve overlap pixel values: from first or last raster, use the min, max or mean of the pixel values, or blend them.

sortField.description: The field name used together with `esriMosaicAttribute` method.

sortValue.description: The base sort value used together with `esriMosaicAttribute` method and `sortField` parameter.

viewpoint.description: Use a view point along with `esriMosaicViewpoint`.

renderingRule_schema.json.title: renderingRule
renderingRule_schema.json.description: Specifies the rendering rule for how the requested image should be rendered.

outputPixelType.description: the output pixel type defines the output image's pixel type.

rasterFunction.description: The raster function name identifies the processing or rendering to be performed. For a list of possible types, please see the [Raster Functions](http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Raster_Function_Objects/02r3000000rv000000/) help topic for additional information on this.

rasterFunctionArguments.description: The arguments for the referenced `rasterFunction`. For a description of arguments per raster function type, please see the [Raster Functions](http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Raster_Function_Objects/02r3000000rv000000/) help topic for additional information on this.

variableName.description: Variable name for the raster function.

dimensionName.description: Type of dimension being used (ex. StdTime).

values.description: Array where every element is either a single value, or an array of two values (lower and upper bound).

popupInfo_schema.json.title: popupInfo
popupInfo_schema.json.description: Defines the look and feel of popup windows when a user clicks or queries a feature.

description.description: A string that appears in the body of the popup window as a description. A basic subset of HTML may also be used to enrich the text. The supported HTML for ArcGIS Online can be seen in the [Supported HTML](https://doc.arcgis.com/en/arcgis-online/reference/supported-html.htm) page.

expressionInfos.description: List of Arcade expressions added to the pop-up.

fieldInfos.description: Array of fieldInfo information properties. This information is provided by the service layer definition.

layerOptions.description: Additional options that can be defined for the popup layer.

mediaInfos.description: Array of various mediaInfo to display. Can be of type `image`, `piechart`, `barchart`, `columnchart`, or `linechart`. The order given is the order in which it displays.

popupElements.description: An array of popupElement objects that represent an ordered list of popup elements.

relatedRecordsInfo.description: Indicates whether to enable related records if they exist on a layer.

showAttachments.description: Indicates whether attachments will be loaded for feature layers that have attachments.

showLastEditInfo.description: Indicates whether popup will display information about when and who last edited the feature. Applicable only to layers that have been configured to keep track of such information.

title.description: A string that appears at the top of the popup window as a title.

popupExpressionInfo_schema.json.title: popupExpressionInfo
popupExpressionInfo_schema.json.description: Arcade expression added to the pop-up.

returnType.description: Return type of the Arcade expression, can be number or string. Defaults to string value. Number values are assumed to be `double`. This can be determined by the authoring client by executing the expression using a sample feature(s), although it can be corrected by the user. Knowing the returnType allows the authoring client to present fields in relevant contexts. For example, numeric fields in numeric contexts such as charts.

fieldInfo_schema.json.title: fieldInfo
fieldInfo_schema.json.description: Defines how a field in the dataset participates (or does not participate) in a popup window.

fieldName.description: A string containing the field name as defined by the service. Anywhere that a fieldname is referenced as `{field-name} in popupInfo, an Arcade expression can also be referenced as `{expression/<expression-name>}`.

format.description: A format object used with numerical or date fields to provide more detail about how the value should be displayed in a popup window.

isEditable.description: A Boolean determining whether users can edit this field. Not applicable to Arcade expressions.

label.description: A string containing the field alias. This can be overridden by the web map author. Not applicable to Arcade expressions as `title` is used instead.

statisticType.description: Used in a 1:many or many:many relationship to compute the statistics on the field to show in the popup.

stringFieldOption.description: A string determining what type of input box editors see when editing the field. Applies only to string fields. Not applicable to Arcade expressions.

tooltip.description: A string providing an editing hint for editors of the field. Not applicable to Arcade expressions.

visible.description: A Boolean determining whether the field is visible in the popup window.

format_schema.json.title: format
format_schema.json.description: The format object can be used with numerical or date fields to provide more detail about how values should be displayed in popup windows.

dateFormat.description: A string used with date fields to specify how the date should appear in popup windows.

digitSeparator.description: A Boolean used with numerical fields. A value of true allows the number to have a digit (or thousands) separator when the value appears in popup windows. Depending on the locale, this separator is a decimal point or a comma. A value of false means that no separator will be used.

places.description: An integer used with numerical fields to specify the number of supported decimal places that should appear in popup windows. Any places beyond this value are rounded.

popupLayerOptions_schema.json.title: Layer Options
popupLayerOptions_schema.json.description: Additional options available for the popup layer.

returnTopmostRaster.description: Indicates whether or not only the topmost raster should be displayed.

showNoDataRecords.description: Indicates whether or not the NoData records should be displayed.

mediaInfo_schema.json.title: mediaInfo
mediaInfo_schema.json.description: Defines an image or a chart to be displayed in a popup window.

mediaInfo_chart_schema.json.title: mediaInfo chart
mediaInfo_chart_schema.json.description: Defines a chart to be displayed in a popup window.

caption.description: A string caption describing the media.

title.description: A string title for the media.

type.description: A string defining the type of media.

mediaInfo_chart_value_schema.json.title: mediaInfo chart value
mediaInfo_chart_value_schema.json.description: The value object contains information for popup windows about how charts should be constructed.

fields.description: An array of strings, with each string containing the name of a field to display in the chart.

normalizeField.description: An optional string containing the name of a field. The values of all fields in the chart will be normalized (divided) by the value of this field.

tooltipField.description: String value indicating the tooltip for a chart specified from another field. This field is needed when related records are not used. It is used for showing tooltips from another field in the same layer or related layer/table.

mediaInfo_image_schema.json.title: mediaInfo image
mediaInfo_image_schema.json.description: Defines an image to be displayed in a popup window.

caption.description: A string caption describing the media.

refreshInterval.description: Refresh interval of the layer in minutes. Non-zero value indicates automatic layer refresh at the specified interval. Value of 0 indicates auto refresh is not enabled. If the property does not exist, it's equivalent to having a value of 0.

title.description: A string title for the media.

type.description: A string defining the type of media.

mediaInfo_image_value_schema.json.title: mediaInfo image value
mediaInfo_image_value_schema.json.description: The value object contains information for popup windows about how images should be retrieved.

linkURL.description: A string containing a URL to be launched in a browser when a user clicks the image.

sourceURL.description: A string containing the URL to the image.

popupElement_schema.json.title: popupElement
popupElement_schema.json.description: Popup elements allow users to author popups, using multiple elements such as tabular views, string description, media (charts and images), and attachments of the attributes and control the order in which they appear. Specifically, popupElements do the following: 1) provide the ability to explicitly add a field/ value table in addition to a description, 2) allow adding multiple description elements, and 3) allow a user to author and consume elements of a popup in the order of their choosing.

displayType.description: A string value indicating how to display the attachment. If `list` is specified, attachments show as links.

fieldInfos.description: It is an array of `fieldInfo` objects representing a field/value pair displayed as a table within the popupElement. If the `fieldInfos` property is not provided, the popupElement will display whatever is specified directly in the `popupInfo.fieldInfos` property.

mediaInfos.description: An array of `mediaInfo` objects representing an image or chart for display. If no `mediaInfos` property is provided, the popupElement will display whatever is specified in the `popupInfo.mediaInfos` property.

esriDocumentation.additionalInformation: Each popupElement has a `type` property. This string value indicates the type of popupElement used.

text.description: This property applies to elements of type `text`. This is string value indicating the text to be displayed within the popupElement. If no `text` property is provided, the popupElement will display whatever is specified in the [popupInfo.description](popupInfo.md) property.

popupElements.text: Some descriptive text describing the popup.

relatedRecordsInfo_schema.json.title: relatedRecordsInfo
relatedRecordsInfo_schema.json.description: The sort in the popupInfo for the parent feature. This impacts the sorting order for the returned child records.

orderByFields.description: Array of orderByFields objects indicating the field display order for the related records and whether they should be sorted in ascending `asc` or descending `desc` order.

showRelatedRecords.description: Required boolean value indicating whether to display related records. If true, client should let the user navigate to the related records. Defaults to true if the layer participates in a relationship AND the related layer/table has already been added to the scene (either as an operationalLayer or as a table).

orderByFields_schema.json.title: orderByFields
orderByFields_schema.json.description: Object indicating the field display order for the related records and whether they should be sorted in ascending or descending order.

field.description: The attribute value of the field selected that will drive the sorting of related records.

order.description: Set the ascending or descending sort order of the returned related records.

mapServiceLayer_schema.json.title: Map Service Layer (ArcGISMapServiceLayer)
mapServiceLayer_schema.json.description: Map services can be cached (tiled) or uncached (dynamic). This object specifically details properties within uncached map services.

id.description: A unique identifying string for the layer.

isReference.description: This is applicable if used as a baseMapLayer. A boolean value indicating whether or not the baseMapLayer draws on top (true) of other layers, including operationalLayers, or below (false).

itemId.description: Optional string containing the item ID of the service if it's registered on ArcGIS Online or your organization's portal.

layers.description: An array of layer objects defining the styling, geometry, and attribute information for the features.

listMode.description: To show or hide the sublayer in the layer list. If the layer has sublayers, selecting `hide-children` will hide them in the layer list.

maxScale.description: A number representing the maximum scale at which the layer will be visible. The number is the scale's denominator.

minScale.description: A number representing the minimum scale at which the layer will be visible. The number is the scale's denominator.

opacity.description: The degree of transparency applied to the layer on the client side, where 0 is full transparency and 1 is no transparency.

refreshInterval.description: Refresh interval of the layer in minutes. Non-zero value indicates automatic layer refresh at the specified interval. Value of 0 indicates auto refresh is not enabled.

showLegend.description: Boolean value indicating whether to display the layer in the legend. Default value is `true`.

title.description: A user-friendly string title for the layer that can be used in a table of contents.

visibility.description: Boolean property determining whether the layer is initially visible in the web scene.

visibleLayers.description: An array of sublayer ids that should appear visible. Used with map service layers that are not tiled.

examples.title: operationalLayer
examples.description: Live sample web scene showing the ArcGISMapServiceLayer as an [operationalLayer](https://www.arcgis.com/home/webscene/viewer.html?webscene=3c04b5e8c19c42e490b0823d05cf7a9d)

layer_schema.json.title: layer
layer_schema.json.description: A layer object may allow overrides on popup content and drawing behavior for individual layers of a web service. This object also contains geographic features and their attributes when used in a feature collection.

defaultVisibility.description: Default visibility of the layers in the map service.

disablePopup.description: Indicates whether to allow a client to ignore the popups defined on the layer. The popupInfo object could be saved in the map or item.

id.description: The layer id, as a numeric value.

layerDefinition.description: Additional properties that define drawing information and other configurations for the layer.

layerUrl.description: A URL to a service that should be used for all queries against the layer.

listMode.description: To show or hide the sublayer in the layer list. If the layer has sublayers, selecting `hide-children` will hide them in the layer list.

maxScale.description: A number representing the maximum scale at which the layer will be visible. The number is the scale's denominator.

minScale.description: A number representing the minimum scale at which the layer will be visible. The number is the scale's denominator.

parentLayerId.description: If working with nested layers, this is the numeric value indicating the layer id of the next layer (parent) directly above the current referenced layer.

popupInfo.description: A popupInfo object defining the popup window content for the layer.

showLabels.description: A Boolean indicating if the layer should display labels in client applications.

showLegend.description: A Boolean indicating if the layer should be shown in the legend in client applications.

subLayerIds.description: If the layer is a parent layer, it will have one or more sub layers included in an array.

openStreetMapLayer_schema.json.title: OpenStreetMap Layer (OpenStreetMap)
openStreetMapLayer_schema.json.description: Allows use of OpenStreetMap data for use in basemaps only.

id.description: An identifying string for the layer, unique per scene.

listMode.description: To show or hide layers in the layer list

maxScale.description: A numeric property used to determine the maximum scale at which the layer is displayed.

minScale.description: A numeric property used to determine the minimum scale at which the layer is displayed.

opacity.description: The degree of transparency applied to the layer on the client side, where 0 is full transparency and 1 is no transparency.

title.description: String title for the basemap layer.

visibility.description: Boolean property determining whether the layer is initially visible.

examples.description: Live sample web scene showing the OpenStreetMap as a [baseMapLayer](https://www.arcgis.com/home/webscene/viewer.html?webscene=45109af15da54a49ab41ba9a3ede92ec)

rasterDataLayer_schema.json.title: Raster Data Layer
rasterDataLayer_schema.json.description: A layer for displaying raster data. This layer only applies to offline data.

copyright.description: Attribution to the Raster Data Layer provider. It is displayed in the attribution on the scene. Input required by the user when the layer is added to the scene.

id.description: A unique identifying string for the layer.

listMode.description: To show or hide the sublayer in the layer list.

maxScale.description: A number representing the maximum scale at which the layer will be visible. The number is the scale's denominator.

minScale.description: A number representing the minimum scale at which the layer will be visible. The number is the scale's denominator.

opacity.description: The degree of transparency applied to the layer on the client side, where 0 is full transparency and 1 is no transparency.

path.description: For offline data, a path to a raster data file. A URI format is used, starting with `file:` followed by a file system path. A relative path must be from the file which defines the layer. For example `file:../commondata/raster_data/beijing.tif`.

title.description: A user-friendly string title for the layer that can be used in a table of contents.

visibility.description: Boolean property determining whether the layer is initially visible in the scene.

tiledImageServiceLayer_schema.json.title: Tiled Image Service Layer (ArcGISTiledImageServiceLayer)
tiledImageServiceLayer_schema.json.description: An ArcGIS Tiled Image Service layer displays content from an ArcGIS Server Image service that has been cached (tiled).

id.description: A unique identifying string for the layer.

isReference.description: Applicable if used as a baseMapLayer. A boolean value indicating whether or not the baseMapLayer draws on top (true) of other layers, including operationalLayers , or below (false).

itemId.description: Optional string containing the item ID of the service if it's registered on ArcGIS Online or your organization's portal.

listMode.description: To show or hide the sublayer in the layer list. If the layer has sublayers, selecting `hide-children` will hide them in the layer list.

maxScale.description: A number representing the maximum scale at which the layer will be visible. The number is the scale's denominator.

minScale.description: A number representing the minimum scale at which the layer will be visible. The number is the scale's denominator.

opacity.description: The degree of transparency applied to the layer on the client side, where 0 is full transparency and 1 is no transparency.

refreshInterval.description: Refresh interval of the layer in minutes. Non-zero value indicates automatic layer refresh at the specified interval. Value of 0 indicates auto refresh is not enabled.

showLegend.description: Boolean value indicating whether to display the layer in the legend. Default value is `true`.

title.description: A user-friendly string title for the layer that can be used in a table of contents.

url.description: URL to the ArcGIS Server Image Service.

visibility.description: Boolean property determining whether the layer is initially visible in the web scene.

examples.title: operationalLayer
examples.description: Live sample web scene showing the ArcGISTiledImageServiceLayer as an [operationalLayer](https://www.arcgis.com/home/webscene/viewer.html?webscene=9cb83d8c8cdb409f9dec93a4c0c9eeb6)

tiledMapServiceLayer_schema.json.title: Tiled Map Service Layer (ArcGISTiledMapServiceLayer)
tiledMapServiceLayer_schema.json.description: An ArcGIS Tiled Map Service layer displays map content from an ArcGIS Server Map service that has been cached (tiled).

id.description: A unique identifying string for the layer.

isReference.description: This property is applicable if used as a baseMapLayer. A boolean value indicating whether or not the baseMapLayer draws on top (true) of other layers, including operationalLayers , or below (false).

itemId.description: Optional string containing the item ID of the service if it's registered on ArcGIS Online or your organization's portal.

layers.description: An array of layer objects defining a URL for queries and the popup window content.

listMode.description: To show or hide the sublayer in the layer list. If the layer has sublayers, selecting `hide-children` will hide them in the layer list.

maxScale.description: A number representing the maximum scale at which the layer will be visible. The number is the scale's denominator.

minScale.description: A number representing the minimum scale at which the layer will be visible. The number is the scale's denominator.

opacity.description: The degree of transparency applied to the layer on the client side, where 0 is full transparency and 1 is no transparency.

path.description: For offline data, a path to a tile package file. A URI format is used, starting with `file:` followed by a file system path with an extension of `.tpk` or `.tpkx`. A relative path must be from the file which defines the layer. For example `file:../p20/northamerica.tpk`.

refreshInterval.description: Refresh interval of the layer in minutes. Non-zero value indicates automatic layer refresh at the specified interval. Value of 0 indicates auto refresh is not enabled.

showLegend.description: Boolean value indicating whether to display the layer in the legend. Default value is `true`.

title.description: A user-friendly string title for the layer that can be used in a table of contents. If this is not included, a title is derived from the service.

url.description: URL to the ArcGIS Server tiled Map Service

visibility.description: Boolean property determining whether the layer is initially visible in the map.

examples.title: operationalLayer
examples.description: Live sample web scene showing the ArcGISTiledMapServiceLayer as an [operationalLayer](https://www.arcgis.com/home/webscene/viewer.html?webscene=b7077db71c5743cb935151efda288835)

examples.title: baseMapLayer
examples.description: Live sample web scene showing the ArcGISTiledMapServiceLayer as a [baseMapLayer](https://www.arcgis.com/home/webscene/viewer.html?webscene=2025161aa6db48f5a640381bbf2cdb93)

vectorTileLayer_schema.json.title: Vector Tile Layer (VectorTileLayer)
vectorTileLayer_schema.json.description: A vector tile layer references a set of web-accessible vector tiles and the corresponding style for how those tiles should be drawn.

id.description: A unique identifying string for the layer.

isReference.description: Applicable if used as a baseMapLayer. A boolean value indicating whether or not the baseMapLayer draws on top (true) of other layers, including operationalLayers , or below (false).

itemId.description: Optional string containing the item ID of the service if it's registered on ArcGIS Online or your organization's portal.

listMode.description: To show or hide the layer in the layer list

maxScale.description: A number representing the maximum scale at which the layer will be visible. The number is the scale's denominator.

minScale.description: A number representing the minimum scale at which the layer will be visible. The number is the scale's denominator.

opacity.description: The degree of transparency applied to the layer on the client side, where 0 is full transparency and 1 is no transparency.

styleUrl.description: A url to a JSON file containing the stylesheet information used to render the layer. You may also pass an object containing the stylesheet information identical to the JSON file.

title.description: A user-friendly string title for the layer that can be used in a table of contents.

visibility.description: Boolean property determining whether the layer is initially visible in the web scene.

webTiledLayer_schema.json.title: WebTiledLayer
webTiledLayer_schema.json.description: A tile layer is a derived from a set of web-accessible tiles which reside on a server. The tiles are accessed by a direct URL request from the web browser. Because the tiles in a tile layer are not available as a service, they must be in a specific format for a web app such as the ArcGIS.com scene viewer to display the layer on a scene.

copyright.description: Attribution to the Web Tiled Layer provider. It is displayed in the attribution on the web scene. Input required by the user when the layer is added to the web scene.

fullExtent.description: An extent object representing the full extent envelope for the layer.

id.description: A unique identifying string for the layer.

isReference.description: This is applicable if used as a basesceneLayer. A boolean value indicating whether or not the basesceneLayer draws on top (true) of other layers, including operationalLayers , or below (false).

itemId.description: Unique string value indicating an item registered in ArcGIS Online or your organization's portal.

listMode.description: To show or hide the layer in the layer list

maxScale.description: A number representing the maximum scale at which the layer will be visible. The number is the scale's denominator.

minScale.description: A number representing the minimum scale at which the layer will be visible. The number is the scale's denominator.

opacity.description: The degree of transparency applied to the layer on the client side, where 0 is full transparency and 1 is no transparency.

refreshInterval.description: Refresh interval of the layer in minutes. Non-zero value indicates automatic layer refresh at the specified interval. Value of 0 indicates auto refresh is not enabled.

subDomains.description: If subdomains are detected, they must be specified. The scene viewer detects if the Web Tiled Layer has subdomains by parsing the templateURL value for {subDomain}.

templateUrl.description: URL to the Web Tiled Layer. Input required by the user when the layer is added to the web scene. The template URL contains a parameterized URL. The URL can contain the following templated parameters: `level`, `col`, `row`, and `subDomain`.

tileInfo.description: Contains the spatial reference and the tiling scheme of the layer. Typically retrieved from a WMTS OGC Web Service. If missing the layer must be in the WGS 1984 Web Mercator (Auxiliary Sphere) tiling scheme.

title.description: A user-friendly string title for the layer that can be used in a table of contents.

visibility.description: Boolean property determining whether the layer is initially visible in the web scene.

wmtsInfo.description: Object containing information about the chosen WMTS service layer and tiling schema.

operationalLayers.title: Layer
operationalLayers.copyright: Map tiles by Stamen Design, under CC BY 3.0. Data by OpenStreetMap, under CC BY SA.

tileInfo_schema.json.title: tileInfo
tileInfo_schema.json.description: Tile information, returned from the WMTS OGC Web Service. The tileInfo will contain the spatial reference of the layer. tileInfo is the same json representation as the ArcGIS Map/Image service tileInfo except that it may contain a levelValue on the lod objects that should be used instead of the level in the templateUrl.

dpi.description: The dpi of the tiling scheme.

lods.description: An array of levels of detail that define the tiling scheme.

spatialReference.description: The spatial reference of the tiling schema.

levelValue.description: String to be used when constructing URL to access a tile from this LOD.

resolution.description: Resolution in map units of each pixel in a tile for each level.

wmtsInfo_schema.json.title: Web Map Tile Service Info
wmtsInfo_schema.json.description: Object defines and provides information about layers in a [WMTSLayer](webTiledLayer.md) service.

customLayerParameters.description: A sequence of parameters used to append different custom parameters to a WMTS tile request. These parameters are applied to `GetTile`. The `customLayerParameters` property takes precedence if `customParameters` is also present.

customParameters.description: A sequence of parameters used to append custom parameters to all WMTS requests. These parameters are applied to `GetCapabilities` and `GetTile`. If used with the `customLayerParameters` property, `customParameters` will not take precedence.

layerIdentifier.description: Identifier for the specific layer used in the WMTS service. Required input by the user.

tileMatrixSet.description: Tiling schema, set by the WMTS service.

url.description: URL to the WMTS web service. Required input by the user.

examples.title: Web Map Service Tile Info
examples.description: The WMTSInfo as used within a WMTS Layer

wmsLayer_schema.json.title: WMS Layer (WMS)
wmsLayer_schema.json.description: A layer consuming a Web Map Service (WMS). The WMS specification is an international specification for serving and consuming dynamic maps on the web.

copyright.description: A string containing copyright and access information for a WMS layer. This is copied from the capabilities document exposed by the WMS service.

customLayerParameters.description: A sequence of custom parameters to WMS layer requests. These parameters are applied to `GetMap` and `GetFeatureInfo` requests. The `customLayerParameters` property takes precedence if `customParameters` is also present.

customParameters.description: A sequence of custom parameters to all WMS requests. These parameters are applied to `GetCapabilities`, `GetMap`, and `GetFeatureinfo` requests. If used with the `customLayerParameters` property, `customParameters` will not take precedence.

extent.description: The minimum bounding rectangle, in decimal degrees, of the area covered by the layer as specified in the capabilities.

featureInfoUrl.description: The URL for the WMS GetFeatureInfo call.

format.description: A string containing the image format to be requested from a WMS service. Default is `png`.

id.description: A unique identifying string for the layer.

isReference.description: This is applicable if used as a baseMapLayer. A boolean value indicating whether or not the baseMapLayer draws on top (true) of other layers, including operationalLayers, or below (false).

itemId.description: Unique string value indicating an item registered in ArcGIS Online or your organization's portal.

layers.description: An array of layer objects from the WMS service.

listMode.description: To show or hide the sublayer in the layer list. If the layer has sublayers, selecting `hide-children` will hide them in the layer list.

mapUrl.description: A string containing the URL of the WMS map. When using a WMS layer, you should also supply the url property. `mapUrl` is the URL returned by the capabilities to be used for the getMap requests.

maxHeight.description: A number defining the maximum height, in pixels, that should be requested from the service.

maxScale.description: A number representing the maximum scale at which the layer will be visible. The number is the scale's denominator.

maxWidth.description: A number defining the maximum width, in pixels, that should be requested from the service.

minScale.description: A number representing the minimum scale at which the layer will be visible. The number is the scale's denominator.

opacity.description: The degree of transparency applied to the layer on the client side, where 0 is full transparency and 1 is no transparency.

refreshInterval.description: Refresh interval of the layer in minutes. Non-zero value indicates automatic layer refresh at the specified interval. Value of 0 indicates auto refresh is not enabled.

showLegend.description: Boolean value indicating whether to display the layer in the legend.

spatialReferences.description: An array of numbers containing well-known IDs for spatial references supported by the service.

title.description: A user-friendly string title for the layer that can be used in a table of contents.

url.description: The URL to the WMS service (`getCapabilities` URL).

version.description: A string containing the version number of the service.

visibility.description: Boolean property determining whether the layer is initially visible in the web map.

visibleLayers.description: An array of layers that should appear visible. The array contains the names of the visible layers.

examples.title: WMS Layer (WMS)
examples.description: WMS layer as an operationalLayer

examples.title: WMS Layer basemap
examples.description: WMS layer as a basemap layer

wmsLayer_layer_schema.json.title: WMSLayer layer
wmsLayer_layer_schema.json.description: A layer object may allow overrides on popup content and drawing behavior for individual layers of a web service.

legendUrl.description: A string URL to a legend graphic for the layer.

name.description: A string containing a unique name for the layer.

queryable.description: Boolean specifying whether a layer is queryable or not.

showPopup.description: Boolean specifying whether to display popup or not.

title.description: A user-friendly string title for the layer that can be used in a table of contents.
